  physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. The background of the image contains buildings
 of different heights
 spanning the horizon. Vehicles and roads can be discerned as well. The foreground of the image contains a large field. Several workers
 all wearing straw hats
 are using hand-held tools to work the ground.

  sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. The photograph shows the Toa Payoh New Town being built
 with new HDB blocks visible in the background.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. Several workers, all wearing straw hats, are using hand-held tools to work the ground.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. The photograph shows the Toa Payoh New Town being built, with new HDB blocks visible in the background.
